fields.name: First Chance Dance
fields.description:
Take your first chance and get down with 1,600 of your newest friends from the Class of 2017. You can’t 
miss your chance! Northwest Labs.

fields.name: Social in the SOCH
fields.description:
Come to the Student Organization Center at Hilles (SOCH) and participate in any of the following 
activities! Some events will be nearby the SOCH, in the Radcliffe Quadrangle. You may choose to ride 
the Shuttle to the Quad. The Shuttle will be departing from the Boylston Gate, on Massachusetts Avenue, 
approximately every 20 minutes.

fields.name: Freshman Talent Show
fields.description:
Come support your classmates as they reveal their hidden talents, and then vote for a grand-prize winner! 
Tickets (free, but limited) will only be available on the evening of the event, first-come, first-served with 
a Freshman Harvard ID. Ticket distribution begins at 5pm at Sanders Theatre. Hosted by the Crimson Key 
Society.

fields.name: Love Story
fields.description:
Watch the Oscar-winning portrayal of the ultimate romance between a Harvard Hockey player and a 
Radcliffe musician who fall in love. Provided with Crimson Key Society’s own live and witty 
commentary. This traditional Opening Days event reminds us all not to take Harvard too seriously. Don’t 
miss out on this Freshman Week tradition! 
$5 tickets can be purchased during dinner at Annenberg, or at the door. Proceeds benefit Crimson Key Society.

fields.name: MAC Quad Splash
fields.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nullam euismod dolor nec ligula pulvinar porttitor. Fusce enim mauris, luctus eget aliquam eu, eleifend ut tortor. Maecenas augue purus, vestibulum sed odio non, pulvinar condimentum quam. Morbi vitae felis nibh. In vitae mi id ipsum mollis bibendum id vitae dolor.

fields.name: A Capella Jam
fields.description: Do Whop what?! Experience a cappella stylings a la Harvard! Tickets (free but limited) will only be available the evening of the event, first-come first-served, beginning at 5 pm at Sanders Theatre. Hosted by the Crimson Key Society.

fields.name: Kick Off Brain Break: The Freshman Green Fair
fields.description: Want to learn how Harvard freshmen satisfy those late-night munchies? Join Green'16 to see how students eat, live, and breathe green at Harvard during your first official Brain Break. Munch on ice cream as you visit the booths of the many environmental groups and activities at Harvard. Most importantly: receive your FREE Green'16 travel mug to use at brain break and Cafes for the rest of the year!

fields.name: Evening Social Events
fields.description:
For events taking place at the Student Organization Center at Hilles (SOCH), you may choose to ride the shuttle to the Quad. The Shuttle will be departing at 9:05, 9:30, 9:45, 10:10, and 10:25 from just outside the Boylston Gate.

9 pm - Movie Night 
The Academy Award winning The Social Network. The Currier Fishbowl

9 pm - Make-Your-Own Nachos
Sponsored by the Crimson Key Society and the SOCH. SOCH Community Hall 1st Floor

9 pm - TV...

fields.name: Convocation Reception
fields.description: University President Drew Gilpin Faust invites all first-year students to a reception to celebrate the Class of 2016 and the start of the 2012-2013 academic year. Light refreshments will be served.

fields.name: Freshman Convocation & Class Photo
fields.description:
4 PM - CONVOCATION PROCESSION 
Join your entryway, your Proctor, and Harvard alumni for a procession into Tercentenary Theatre. Meet outside your entryway promptly at 4 pm. Dressy attire is suggested. This is a great time for taking photos!

4:30 PM - CONVOCATION
University President Drew Gilpin Faust, Dean of Faculty Michael D. Smith, Dean of the College Evelynn M. Hammonds, Reverent Professor Jonathan L. Walton, and Dean of Freshmen Thomas A....

fields.name: Charles River Picnic
fields.description: Enjoy the sun and the beauty of the Charles River with your new friends, classmates and The Crimson Key Society! Play volleyball, badminton or cornhole, while you enjoy picnic snacks and drinks along the banks of Cambridge's famous river. Hosted by the Crimson Key Society. Weather permitting.
fields.location: Charles River in front of Leverett and Winthrop

fields.name: Freshman Talent Show
fields.description: Come support your classmates revel in their talents, and vote for a grand-prize winner! Tickets (free but limited) will only be available on the evening of the event, first-come first-served with Freshman Harvard ID, beginning at 5 pm at Sanders Theatre. Hosted by the Crimson Key Society.

This traditional Opening Days event reminds us all not to take Harvard too seriously! $5 tickets can be purchased at the door or during dinner in Annenberg. Proceeds benefit Crimson Key Society.

fields.name: Official Welcome to Families of the Class of 2016
fields.description: Dean of the College Evelynn M. Hammonds, Dean of Freshmen Thomas Dingman, and Dr. Margie McKenna, parent of a current college student and a consultant in psychiatry to University Health Services, extend a warm welcome to the families of the Class of 2016. Come learn more about Harvard and the first year in particular. Advice will be offered to parents about what to expect during this important time of transition for both students and families...
